Victor

Welcome, my name is Victor and I am currently a fourth-year computer engineering student at the University of Florida.

<

Daniel

I was born in Lima, Peru and lived there for 7 years before my family came to the United States. Back in Peru, most people went by their middle name; so it was quite an adjustment being called from Daniel to Victor.

Hu

My parents are from Guangzhou, China and I am a the first in my family to attend college. I work hard every day in order to achieve a successful future and thank my parents for their sacrifices.

About Me

Victor Daniel Hu

Student at The University of Florida

B.S. Computer Engineering, Class of 2016

"Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition." - Steve Jobs

My dream is to one day start my own company and accumulate enough resources to travel the world and immerse myself amongst other cultures. Growing up, my parents didn't have the time to take me traveling.

Experience

Florida Cicerones Gainesville, FL

  • One of the most selective and prestigious organizations, serving as the official campus ambassadors of the university. Chosen from a pool of over 900 applicants.
  • Connecting past, present, and future Gators through events by the Student Alumni Association and serving as a tour guide for prospective students and families.
  • Creating a positive and impressive image of the university, yielding higher application rates and national campus recognition.

Verizon Communications Irving, TX

  • Migrated Verizon's SSP Adapters and Workflow code repository from IBM's ClearCase to Git with Stash Integration.
  • Designed workflow for developers to follow in order to reduce the room for error.
  • Led multiple training sessions to prepare the team for the upcoming changes in technology, most of the team is stationed in VDSI.
  • Reduced licensing and training costs while decreasing time between release cycles.

Interests and Skills

Career Interests

This past Summer, I developed an interest towards cybersecurity and The Internet of Things. This is because interning at such a large business showed me the scale of projects being completed; as well as profits they generate. This puts a huge target on such organizations so I think it would be an interesting area to go into. I'm also interested in the IoT because I believe in reducing humans' carbon footprint. It is also a great way to continue simplifying human life and use technology to our advantage. I also have an interest in entrepreneurship.

Technical Skills

I am most familiar with Java and C++, but unfortnuately my experience does not extend beyond the class room. I have also have worked with PHP, SQL, HTML, CSS, JS, and Assembly Language. I am very excited for my courses this semester because I will be creating an iOS application using Swift 2 and a webtool using the MEAN.JS stack.

Personal Interests

On my spare time, I enjoy hanging out with friends, playing basketball,, and lifting weights,. Last Fall I took a trip for the first time with a couple of friends and fell a victim to wanderlust,. I also have interests in cars,, but don't really have the time or resources at this stage of my life to pick it up as a more serious hobby. Above all, I'm always open to trying new things, and exploring what this world has to offer.
